Retired NGO executive doing my best to stay informed and raise awareness about environmental crises, climate breakdown, and the rapacious, murderous impact of greedy capitalists and the politicians they own.

Why the name? Back in the day, empires placated their citizens with "bread and circuses." Now we get fast food and apps. But it's all basically the same — distraction from what's REALLY happening.

descendants.content: @breadandcircuses

@breadandcircuses

It is, but in nearing completion of Debt: the first 5000 years, Graeber peeled away the layers of history to demonstrate that the philosophical outlook that defines capitalism predates it.

It's a distillation of outlooks forged from earlier eras. Eras of blood and terror, all bound to beliefs built up around war, debt and servitude. Like those eras before, masses of people will find themselves expelled out of the system.

It's an opportunity to retrieve our humanity

descendants.content: @GhostOnTheHalfShell @breadandcircuses This is a book I frequently reference, too. Capitalism is awful in many cases and a mixed bag in others, but currency and debt concepts, alongside ruling classes/societies over-consuming, long predate it, including in times and places most people like to think were different. As much as capitalism is a problem, thinking it is *the* problem also feels wrong. Sometimes I wonder if we'd find utopia by teaching humans how to spot and deal with narcissists, hah.

descendants.content:
@neonharbinger @GhostOnTheHalfShell @breadandcircuses

Ask them if they can be wrong. Any reasonably well-adjusted person on a good day should probably be able to communicate “Yes. I have made mistakes before. I have hurt people out of impulsivity and selfishness. Any person will always do that, but I would like to do it less.”

Crap, there was a really good youtube comment I replied to in the last couple days about this I can’t fully remember though. They mentioned a way to unmask narcissists / harmfully self-centered people, I added my idea, and now I unfortunately can’t remember theirs. Damn.

descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses The problem here is, "the capitalism" that is blamed (and not unjustly) for everything, it's not something alien. It's what you and me and Uncle Joe live and do every day. It's not the Martians killing biodiversity. It's us. Of course, it's convenient to blame it on something outside, but it's really us. you and me and Uncle Joe.

Just like back in the time of Stalin's repressions, everyone used to say, it's not us, it's the system! But who were the system? Not the Martians. It was everyone and their kindergarten friends and classmates and friends and work colleagues and cousins. It was everyone around them. There is nowhere to shift the blame.

And it's the same with the killing of the planet. It's not 'capitalism'. It's us.

If we all refused to do it, 'capitalism' couldn't do it without us.

The ultimate question is, what do we do about it?

I see many people standing up for, articulating, and carrying out better ways of being. https://johnabbe.wagn.org/assumptions_of_power_with_culture
